page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {HALL BROOM:}A farm with many fine brooms(type of shrub) {ROD MOOR:}Moorland until road running through or along side. {CORTER WALLS:}A form of dry stone walling (?) {HOLLOW MEADOWS:}Low lying meadows with a stream nearby. {ROYDE CLOUGH:}was full of very old beech trees planted in about 1755 but they were blown down in 1955 and replanted. {CRAWSHAW MOOR:}was a plantation at some time.The whole area was owned by the {Duke of Norfolk.}There were no fences but after the enclosure act of the early 1800's Crawshaw was enclosed and Crawshaw lodge and Crawshaw farm were built.The trees were felled and the area returned to heather.
